availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jessee Smith (Warren County, Kentucky, physician and minister)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, physician and minister. Kentucky native. Son of David Smith. Married to Eliza J. Norman Smith in Ohio County, Kentucky, in 1854. Father of Lilly Smith. Physician in Warren County in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved persons in warren County in 1850. Minister in Warren County in 1860. Held eight enslaved persons as the administrator of David Smith's will in Warren County in 1860. Physician and minister in Warren County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 1B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 449B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Warren County, KY, July1863, p. 28.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Ohio County Marriages, Film #000494956, p. 990.
"Dr. John H. Smith (1825-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial #29393227, accessed August 29, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/29393227.
